gurmukhi: ijh kwl ibAwl kitE n AMg ] A`CY srUp AKY ABMg ]
transliteration: Jih Kaal Biaal Katio Na An|| Achchhai Saroopakhai Abhan||
translation: Thou art That whose bodily limb hath never been stung by the serpent of death. Who is Unassailable Entity and Who is Indestructible and Imperishable.

gurmukhi: ijh nyq nyq audrMq byd ] ijh AlK rUp k`Qq kqyb ]7]127]
transliteration: Jih Net Net Ouchrant Bed|| Jih Alakh Roop Katthat Kateb||7||127||
translation: Whom the Vedas call ‘Neti, Neti’ (Not this, not this) and infinite. Whom the Semitic Scriptures call Incompre-hensible.7.127.

gurmukhi: ijh AlK rUp Awsn Afol ] ijh Aimq qyj ACY Aqol ]
transliteration: Jih Alakh Roop Aasan Adol|| Jih Amit Tej Achhai Atol||
translation: Whose Form is Unknowable and Whose Seat is stable. Whose light is unlimited and who is Invincible and Unweighable.

gurmukhi: ijh iDAwn kwj muin jn AnMq ] keI klp jog swDq durMq ]8]128]
transliteration: Jih Dhiaan Kaaj Mounndi) Jan Anant|| Kaee Kalap Jog S3dhat Durant||8||128||
translation: For Whose meditation and sight, infinite sages perform hard Yoga Practices for many kalpas (ages).8.128.

gurmukhi: qn sIq Gwm brKw shMq ] keI klp eyk Awsn ibqMq ]
transliteration: Tan Soot Ghaam Barkhaa Sahant|| Kaee Kalap Ek Aasan Bitant||
translation: For Thy realization they endure cold, heat and rain on their body. For many ages they remain in the same posture.

gurmukhi: keI jqn jog ib`idAw ibcwr ] swDMq qdip pwvl n pwr ]9]129]
transliteration: Kaee Jatan Jog Biddiaa Bichaar|| Saadhant Tadap(i) Paavat Na Paar||9||129||
translation: They make many efforts and ruminate over the learning of Yoga. They practice Yoga, but still they cannot know Thy end. 9.129.

gurmukhi: keI aurD bwh dysn BRmMq ] keI aurD mD pwvk JulMq ]
transliteration: Kaee Uradh Baah Desan Bhramannd|| Kaee Uradh Madh Paavak Jhulant||
translation: Many wander in several countries with raised arms. Many burn their bodies upside down.

gurmukhi: keI isMmiRiq swsqR aucrMq byd ] keI kok kwb k`Qq kqyb ]10]130]
transliteration: Kaee Sinmrit(i) Saastra Ouchrant Bed|| Kaee Kok Kaab Katthat Kateh||10||130||
translation: Many recite Smritis, Shastras and Vedas. Many go through Kok Shastras (pertaining to sex), other poetry books and Semitic Scriptures. 10.130.

gurmukhi: keI augn hoqR keI paun Ahwr ] keI krq kot miRq ko Ahwr ]
transliteration: Kaee Agad Hotra Kaee Paoun Ahaar|| Kaee Karat Kot Mrit Ko Ahaar||
translation: Many perform havan (fire-worship) and many subsist on air. Many a million eat clay.

gurmukhi: keI krq swk pY pqR B`C ] nhI qdip dyv hovq pRq`C ]11]131]
transliteration: Kaee Karat Saak Pai Patra Bhachchh|| Nahi Tadap(i) Dev Bovat Pratachchh||11||131||
translation: May people eat green leaves. Still the Lord does not manifest Himself to them. 11.131.

gurmukhi: keI gIq gwn gMDrb rIq ] keI byd swsqR ibidAw pRqIq ]
transliteration: Kaee Goot Gadn Gaddharab Root|| Kaee Bed Saastra Bidiaa Pratoot||
translation: There are many song-tunes and observances of Gandharvas. There are many who are absorbed in the learning of Vedas and Shastras.

gurmukhi: khUM byd rIiq j`g Awid krm ] khUM Agn hoqR khUM qIrQ Drm ]12]132]
transliteration: Kahoon Bed Root(i) Jagg Aadh Karam|| Kahoon Agad Hotra Kahoon Teerath Dharam||12||132||
translation: Somewhere Yagyas (sacrifices) are performed according to the Vedic injunctions. Somewhere havens are performed and somewhere at pilgrim-stations, the befitting rituals are being followed.12.132.

gurmukhi: keI dys dys BwKw rtMq ] keI dys dys ibidAw pVHMq ]
transliteration: Kaee Des Des Bhaakhaa Ratant|| Kaee Des Des Bidiaa Padhant||
translation: Many speak languages of different countries. Many study the learning of various countries. Many study the learning of various countries.

gurmukhi: keI krq BwNq BwNqn ibcwr ] nhI nYku qwsu pwXq n pwr ]13]133]
transliteration: Kaee Kadat Bhaant Bhaantan Bichaar|| Nahoo Naik(u) Taas(u) Paayat Na Paar||13||133||
translation: Many ruminate over several types of philosophies. Still they cannot comprehend even a little of the Lord. 13.133.
